  • Classes in sorcer.service used by edu.pjatk.inn.coffeemaker 
    Class and Description
    Context
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
  • Classes in sorcer.service used by edu.pjatk.inn.coffeemaker.impl 
    Class and Description

    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.

    An top-level common interface for all mograms in SORCER.

  • Classes in sorcer.service used by sorcer.arithmetic.provider.impl 
    Class and Description
    Context
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
    EvaluationException 
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Server#service, to a service provider Server.
    Identifiable 
    Job
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    Monitorable
    All providers that need to be monitored implement this interface.
    MonitorException 
    Service
    Created by Mike Sobolewski.

  • Classes in sorcer.service used by sorcer.core.context 
    Class and Description
    Arg
    Any named configuration parameter value in particular a free variable.
    AssociativeContext 
    Call
    An top-level common interface for all primitive service in SORCER.
    Context
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    Contexter
    A service interface related to Context evaluation/invocation and accessing contexts of of context service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
    ContextManagement
    Context Management provides methods for managing contexts over the network.
    Dependency
    A functionality required by major evaluations in SORCER.
    Domain
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 7/26/16.
    Evaluation
    A functionality required by all evaluations in SORCER.
    EvaluationException 
    Exec 
    Exec.State
    A State can be associated with the ExecState and other attributes of executing exertions (see sorcer.core.provider.exertmonitor.ExertMonitor)
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Server#service, to a service provider Server.
    ExertionException
    The ExertionException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process it correctly.
    Identifiable 
    IndexedContext 
    Invocation
    The Invocation interface defines context driven invocations on a service context containing its parameters (paths) and arguments (values).
    Job
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    Link
    The Link interface allows path values of service contexts to be linked to other service contexts using instances implementing this interface.
    Mappable
    Implicit Maps such that a path indicates internal structure of composition with the last inner component indicated by the path.
    Mogram
    An top-level common interface for all mograms in SORCER.
    MogramException
    The MogramException represents an exception that is thrown if a mogram is evaluated or performed by a service provider failing to process it correctly.
    MogramStrategy
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 8/2/15.
    Paradigmatic
    A Paradigm instance can return exact data or evaluated (reevaluated - of Evaluation type).
    Path 
    Positioning 
    ProviderInfo
    The ProviderInfo class defines human-oriented information about a SORCER provider.
    Request
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 5/16/16.
    Scopable 
    Service
    Created by Mike Sobolewski.
    ServiceExertion 
    ServiceFidelity 
    ServiceMogram
    Created by sobolemw on 5/4/15.
    SetterException 
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    Signature.Direction 
    Signature.Kind 
    Signature.ReturnPath 
    SignatureException 
    SignatureReturnPath
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 12/22/15.
    SpaceContext 
    Strategy 
    Strategy.Access
    When the access type of a control context is set to PULL then the associated exertion is passed onto a Spacer, otherwise (access type is PUSH) the exertion is passed directly on to the provider specified by the PROCsignature.
    Strategy.Flow
    There are three flow types that can be associated with exertions control context.
    Strategy.Monitor
    The CONCURRENT flow is controlled by mutex state WAIT, NOTIFY, and NOTIFY_ALL of the control context.
    Strategy.Opti 
    Strategy.Wait
    Indicates whether the service requestor waits for results or not.
    Substitutable
    Created by Mike Sobolewski.
    Task
    A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.

  • Classes in sorcer.service used by sorcer.core.context.node 
    Class and Description
    EvaluationException 
  • Classes in sorcer.service used by sorcer.core.deploy 
    Class and Description
    Arg
    Any named configuration parameter value in particular a free variable.
    Deployment
    Attributes related to signature based deployment.
    Deployment.Strategy
    DYNAMIC indicates that a service will be deployed to available machine instances that support the service's operational criteria up to the amount specified by the number of planned instances.
    Deployment.Type
    There are three types of provisioning: per signature (SELF), for a collection of signatures as a federation (all signatures in exertion with Type.FED), and no provisioning (suspended provisioning) for a signature (NONE)
    Deployment.Unique
    A service can be deployed with uniqueness.
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Server#service, to a service provider Server.
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    SignatureException 
    Strategy.Provision
    Indicates if on-demand provisioning is used for not existing currently service but required in the overlay network of service providers..

    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.
    Exec 
    Exec.State
    A State can be associated with the ExecState and other attributes of executing exertions (see sorcer.core.provider.exertmonitor.ExertMonitor)
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Server#service, to a service provider Server.
    ExertionInfo

    An top-level common interface for all mograms in SORCER.
    Monitorable
    All providers that need to be monitored implement this interface.
    MonitorException 
    RemoteServiceEvent
    Wrapper around RemoteEvent to allow user defined event objects.

    ServiceFidelity 
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    Signature.Direction 
    Signature.Kind 
    Signature.Operating
    Used to indicate if signature is active.
    Signature.Operation 
    Signature.ReturnPath 
    Signature.ServiceMultitype 
    Signature.Type
    There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PRE (preprocess), PROC (process/service) , POST (postprocess), and APD_DATA (append data) and code>APD_CONTROL (append control strategy).
    SignatureException 
    SignatureReturnPath
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 12/22/15.
    Strategy.Access
    When the access type of a control context is set to PULL then the associated exertion is passed onto a Spacer, otherwise (access type is PUSH) the exertion is passed directly on to the provider specified by the PROCsignature.
    Strategy.Provision
    Indicates if on-demand provisioning is used for not existing currently service but required in the overlay network of service providers..
    Strategy.Shell
    Indicates whether to use ServiceShell locally or remotely (as ServiceProvider).

    Deployment
    Attributes related to signature based deployment.
    Deployment.Strategy
    DYNAMIC indicates that a service will be deployed to available machine instances that support the service's operational criteria up to the amount specified by the number of planned instances.
    Deployment.Type
    There are three types of provisioning: per signature (SELF), for a collection of signatures as a federation (all signatures in exertion with Type.FED), and no provisioning (suspended provisioning) for a signature (NONE)
    Deployment.Unique
    A service can be deployed with uniqueness.

    Setup
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 12/9/16.
    Signature
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services.
    Signature.Direction 
    Signature.In 
    Signature.Kind 
    Signature.Operating
    Used to indicate if signature is active.
    Signature.Out 
    Signature.Paths 
    Signature.ReturnPath 
    Signature.SessionPaths 
    Signature.Type
    There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PRE (preprocess), PROC (process/service) , POST (postprocess), and APD_DATA (append data) and code>APD_CONTROL (append control strategy).
    SignatureException 
    SignatureReturnPath
    Created by Mike Sobolewski on 12/22/15.
    Strategy.Access
    When the access type of a control context is set to PULL then the associated exertion is passed onto a Spacer, otherwise (access type is PUSH) the exertion is passed directly on to the provider specified by the PROCsignature.
    Strategy.FidelityManagement 
    Strategy.Flow
    There are three flow types that can be associated with exertions control context.
    Strategy.Monitor
    The CONCURRENT flow is controlled by mutex state WAIT, NOTIFY, and NOTIFY_ALL of the control context.
    Strategy.Opti 
    Strategy.Provision
    Indicates if on-demand provisioning is used for not existing currently service but required in the overlay network of service providers..
    Strategy.Shell
    Indicates whether to use ServiceShell locally or remotely (as ServiceProvider).
    Strategy.Wait
    Indicates whether the service requestor waits for results or not.
    Substitutable
    Created by Mike Sobolewski.
    Task
    A Task is an elementary service-oriented message Exertion (with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
    UnknownExertionException
    Any interaction with the MonitorSessionManager might result in this exception due to the following reasons: The session does not exist, Some operations on this session which was not valid.

    Call
    An top-level common interface for all primitive service in SORCER.
    Context
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    ContextException
    The ServiceContextException represents an exception that is thrown if an exertion is performed by a service provider failing to process the associated service context correctly due to incorrect context paths, values, or associations.

    A functionality required by major evaluations in SORCER.

  • Classes in sorcer.service used by sorcer.sml.jobs 
    Class and Description
    Context
    Service context classes that implement this interface provide SORCER generic metacomputing data structures for storage, retrieval, and propagation of heterogeneous information across all SORCER service providers.
    Exertion
    An exertion is a federated service command (statement) communicated by a requestor - Server#service, to a service provider Server.
    Job
    A job is a composite service-oriented message comprised of Exertion instances with its own service Context and a collection of service Signatures.
